title: Email Recovery
content:
Email Recovery#When using non-custodial smart contract wallets, once users lose access to the key due to all sorts of reasons, they won’t be able to control the account anymore. To regain their control, the users need to replace the account’s key through account recovery.
With our unique on-chain email verification technology, users can set multiple internet emails as guardians of the account, which can help users achieve account recovery by simply submitting emails to smart contract on chain. This greatly lowers the requirement on guardians and allows all your family members and friends with emails to become guardians of your account.
AA Wallet allowed the difficulty to owning and guarding a wallet account to Web2 level, giving users a smart contract account truly easy to understand, operate, and manage.
Privacy preserving#Because Web2 accounts’ private account information is stored in centralized servers outsiders cannot access, in normal circumstances these private information would not be leaked. Since AA Wallet is a non-custodial smart contract wallet, even though it stores users’ sensitive information after hashing, when such information is verified on chain, it is still possible that it could be exposed.

title: Quick Login
content:
We currently only support Google account loginAgree Terms And Statement#You need to agree to our terms of use and statement before you can log in
Select Google Account#Select the google account you want to log in and click
Login Success#After successful login, you can see the following page

title: Import Token
content:
You can import your other token assets through this function
Click Import Tokens#Click “Import tokens” to add the token you want to import
Enter The Token Address#Paste the asset contract address you want to add in the input box and click the add button.
Token Import Completed#Now you can see the token you imported

title: Multi Chain Support
content:
Multi-chain Support#AA Wallet supports all EVM-compatible chains and gives users the same address across all chains using EIP-2470. Currently supported chains are:
Mainnet List#Base Mainnet Linea Mainnet Testnet List#Coq Testnet Base Testnet Linea Testnet

title: Import NFT
content:
You can import your NFT assets through this function
Select the NFTs tab#Click NFTs to switch to the NFT tab
Click Import NFTs#Click “Import NFTs” to add the NFT you want to import
Enter The NFT Information#Enter the NFT contract address and tokenID, then click import button
Waiting For Import Results#NFT Import Completed#Now you can see the nft you imported

title: Sdk
content:
Download SDK source code#Go to sdk github page, clone code to local folder.
git clone https://github.com/coyaweb3/AA-SDK.git Notice This folder is the SDK code : AA-SDK/src/popup-sdk .
This is the SDK sample code : AA-SDK/src/App.tsx .Run SDK example#Notice nodejs version is v16.13.2In the AA-SDK/src/popup-sdk directory, you can run:
yarn install In the AA-SDK/src directory, you can run:
yarn install In the AA-SDK/src directory, you can run:
yarn start How to use sdk#open AA-SDK/src/App.tsx
1.import sdk#import { AAPopupSDK } from './popup-sdk/src/index'; import { ConnectType, AAEvent, AAEventType } from './popup-sdk/src/types/index'; import { getChainId, setChainId } from './popup-sdk/src/chainId'; 2.create sdk object with config#const domain = 'wallet-dev.coya.biz'; const protocol = 'https'; aaWallet = new AAPopupSDK({ storageType: 'localStorage', walletUrl: { domain, protocol, }, }); 3.initialize account#const getAccount = aaWallet.getAccount(); 4.login with sdk#const connect = async (connectType?: ConnectType) => { const account = await aaWallet.login({ email: false, eventListener: (event: AAEvent) => { console.log('event', event); const { type, body } = event; if (type === AAEventType.REGISTER) { console.log('a user register'); } }, connectType, }); if (account) { messageApi.success('login successful'); setTimeout(() => { window.location.reload(); }); } }; After successful login, the account information will be saved in the browser local storage. local storage key is “AA-WALLET”.
When an authentication error occurs, please call the connect method again to update this value.
5.select chain#For example, Use linea testnet to send transactions:
import { getChainId, setChainId } from './popup-sdk/src/chainId'; setChainId(e.target.value); 6.send transaction#Notice the gas fee used for sending transactions is the native token.1.send native token transfer#import { parseEther } from 'ethers'; const sendNative = async (connectType?: ConnectType) => { const fromAddress = '0xa8D3697406225891b449a0940D824E1Af9E435C9'; const toAddress = '0xa8D3697406225891b449a0940D824E1Af9E435C9'; const native = '0.000001' const tx = { from: fromAddress, to: toAddress, value: '0x' + parseEther(native).toString(16), data: '0x', }; txHash.value = await aaWallet.sendTransaction(tx); if (txHash.value) { messageApi.info(txHash.value); } }; 2.send erc20 token transfer#Notice can call smart contracts method by this wayimport { Interface, parseUnits, parseEther } from 'ethers'; const sendToken = async () => { try { const erc20Interface = new Interface(['function transfer(address _to, uint256 _value)']); const erc20TokenData = erc20Interface.encodeFunctionData('transfer', [ '0x2CF88b803C96ED43Ef9b35c9FEdE49dfc79EAb35', parseUnits(erc20Amount, 18), ]); const tx = { from: '0xa8D3697406225891b449a0940D824E1Af9E435C9', //your AA account address, in local storage, key is AA-WALLET. to: erc20ContractAddress, value: '0x0', data: erc20TokenData, }; res = await aaWallet.sendTransaction(tx); if (res) { messageApi.info(txHashERC20.value); } } catch (err: any) { messageApi.error(err?.message); } };

title: What Is Erc4377
content:
What is ERC-4337#ERC-4337(Account Abstraction via Entry Point Contract specification) is a specification that aims to use entry point contract to achieve account abstraction without changing the consensus layer protocol of Ethereum.
ERC-4337 is still in draft stage and not finalized yet. But since ERC-4337 will not change the consensus layer, there are already implementations available like OpenZeppelin and Stackup.
ERC-4337 defines some new rules, like introducing higher-layer pseudo-transaction object called UserOperation, use bundlers to package a set of these objects into a transaction for batch verification and execution, and introducing paymaster mechanism that can achieve decentralized gas fee payment sponsorship.

title: Switch Network
content:
You can switch to any of our supported networks using the Switch Network function
Click Current Network#Click on the current network
Switch To Target Network#In the pop-up network list, click the target network you want to switch to.
Network Switching Completed#Now you have successfully switched to the target network

title: Send Token
content:
You can use the send function to transfer token
Select Token#Quick Send Native Token#Click the “send”
Standard Send ERC-20 Token#Click on the token you want to send in the token list
Click the “send”
Enter Destination Address And Amount#After entering the transfer destination address and the amount to be transferred, click the send button.
Address is the destination address to be send
Asset is your token information, including token name and balance
Amount is the number of tokens you want to send
Select Payment Method#Select the payment method you need and click the submit button
Native Payment
Use native tokens to pay fees
Erc20 Paymaster
Use other tokens to pay fees
Waiting For Submission Result#Please pay attention to whether the balance is sufficient before submitting
If the submission is successful, the page will automatically return to the homepage, otherwise it will stay on this page.
You can go to the Activity page to view the final send result.

title: Send NFT
content:
You can use the send function to transfer nft
Switch To NFT Tab#Select NFT#Select the NFT you want to send and click
Click Send#On the NFT details page, click the send button
Enter Dstination Address#After entering the transfer destination address, click the send button.
Select Payment Method#Select the payment method you need and click the submit button
Native Payment
Use native tokens to pay fees
Erc20 Paymaster
Use other tokens to pay fees
Waiting For Submission Result#Please pay attention to whether the balance is sufficient before submitting
If the submission is successful, the page will automatically return to the homepage, otherwise it will stay on this page.
You can go to the Activity page to view the final send result.

title: Activity
content:
You can view the sending result of Token or NFT in the activity
Activity can view a list of ongoing and completed transactionsSwitch To Activity Tab#View List#Find the data you want to view in the Activity list
View Detail#Click on the data you want to view. In the pop-up window, you can see the transaction hash and user operation hash.
You can click on the hash to open the corresponding browser to view the details of the transaction.
Clicking on the transaction hash will jump to the blockchain browser of the corresponding network.
Clicking on user operation hash will jump to our ERC-4337 UserOps Explorer
